properties.areaDesc: Ashe; Watauga; Carroll; Grayson; Patrick; Floyd; Surry; Alleghany; Wilkes
properties.headline: Flood Watch issued February 5 at 4:46AM EST until February 7 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Blacksburg VA
properties.description:
... Flood Watch Tonight through Friday Morning...

.As a cold front slowly moves over the Mid-Atlantic today and
Thursday, an extended period of rain showers will bring two to
four inches of rain to the area. Highest rainfall rates are
expected Thursday afternoon, along with potential for
thunderstorms in the North Carolina mountains.

The National Weather Service in Blacksburg has issued a

* Flood Watch for portions of North Carolina and southwest
Virginia, including the following areas, in North Carolina,
Alleghany NC, Ashe, Surry, Watauga, and Wilkes. In southwest
Virginia, Carroll, Floyd, Grayson, and Patrick.

* From late tonight through Friday morning

* An extended period of rainfall with high rainfall rates and
thunderstorms on Thursday create favorable conditions for
flooding.

* The ground will be saturated when thunderstorms are most likely.
High rainfall rates inside of these storms could potentially
create rapid water rises, especially in small creeks and
streams, areas with poor drainage, and low lying areas.
properties.instruction:
A Flood Watch means there is a potential for flooding based on
current forecasts.

You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible
Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be
prepared to take action should flooding develop.

NWSheadline: FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING
